unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Concerns Rise at Tirupati Electronics**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Concerns Rise at Tirupati Electronics**

unnormalised: TIRUPATI, Andhra Pradesh – Concerns are mounting over quality control procedures at Tirupati Electronics following reports of defective components in their latest line of LED televisions. A preliminary investigation, spearheaded by Dr. Sharma of IIT Madras, suggests inconsistencies in the procurement of raw materials from various vendors across the country.
normalised: TIRUPATI, Andhra Pradesh – Concerns are mounting over quality control procedures at Tirupati Electronics following reports of defective components in their latest line of L E D televisions. A preliminary investigation, spearheaded by Doctor Sharma of I I T Madras, suggests inconsistencies in the procurement of raw materials from various vendors across the country.

unnormalised: Reports indicate that a batch of capacitors, sourced from a Delhi-based supplier, failed to meet the required specifications, leading to premature failures in the final product. Industry analysts estimate the potential recall cost to be upwards of Rs. 50 lakhs.
normalised: Reports indicate that a batch of capacitors, sourced from a Delhi-based supplier, failed to meet the required specifications, leading to premature failures in the final product. Industry analysts estimate the potential recall cost to be upwards of rupee fifty lakhs.

unnormalised: "Stringent quality checks at every stage of the manufacturing process are crucial," emphasized Ms. Kapoor, President of the All-India Electronics Manufacturers Association. The company is reportedly undertaking a comprehensive review of its quality assurance protocols across its 50,000 sq ft manufacturing facility. Further updates are expected by next week.
normalised: "Stringent quality checks at every stage of the manufacturing process are crucial," emphasized Miss Kapoor, President of the All-India Electronics Manufacturers Association. The company is reportedly undertaking a comprehensive review of its quality assurance protocols across its fifty thousand square feet manufacturing facility. Further updates are expected by next week.
